        <td id="LC9" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">This is a sample ACS analysis from Kaggle script &lt;https://www.kaggle.com/owise83/d/census/2013-american-community-survey/should-i-do-a-phd/code&gt;.</td>

        <td id="LC11" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">The goal of this analysis is to empirically check if an US citizen/resident should pursue his/her education to higher levels, whether it is worth doing it, and if so where abouts (which states), is there a correlation or pattern between higher income and higher degree level? </td>
      </tr>

        <td id="L282" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="282"></td>
        <td id="LC282" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Interestingly, there are a common states repeated in the three degree levels. The states  of &quot;Oregon&quot;, &quot;Massachusetts&quot;, &quot;California&quot; has the hieghest unemployment rate in all degree levels (B.Sc, MSc, and PhD) whereas &quot;montana&quot;, &quot;oklahoma&quot;  have the lowest unemployment rate in all degree levels.  </td>

        <td id="L284" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="284"></td>
        <td id="LC284" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">It is worth investigaing why!!</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>

      <tr>
        <td id="L286" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="286"></td>
        <td id="LC286" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Now, those who were lucky enough, pursued higher level of education, and secured jobs, do they really get paid higher?</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L287" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="287"></td>

        <td id="LC288" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-mh"><span class="pl-mh">#</span>What about their income?</span></td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L289" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="289"></td>
        <td id="LC289" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Last question: do PhD degrees earn more than the rest of the guys? In this part, we exclude those who earns less than $ $1000 $</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L290" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="290"></td>
        <td id="LC290" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">  </td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L291" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="291"></td>
        <td id="LC291" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Because of the large number of data, we conduct the analysis on a sample. To make it more generalizable, for each degree level we randomly draw $5000$ samples (subset) of $1000$ observations each and compute  some statistics (<span class="pl-c1">`min()`</span>, <span class="pl-c1">`max()`</span>, <span class="pl-c1">`median()`</span>, and <span class="pl-c1">`IQR()`</span>) of the income in that sample.</td>
      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L292" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="292"></td>
        <td id="LC292" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">
</td>
      </tr>

      </tr>
      <tr>
        <td id="L295" class="blob-num js-line-number" data-line-number="295"></td>
        <td id="LC295" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line"><span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-smi">aboveThousand</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> <span class="pl-smi">ds</span> %<span class="pl-k">&gt;</span>%</span></td>
      </tr>

        <td id="LC353" class="blob-code blob-code-inner js-file-line">Yes, it is worth pursuing your education and worth doing a PhD as you will end up being paid higher than other degree levels.
